children.text: There are cold and hot water pipes that have been installed in close contact/touching, where the cold water service will be heated.
‘Drinking water that is not intentionally heated must be delivered at a temperature of less than 40 degrees Celsius’ .
The relevant Australian Standard AS 3500.1 Plumbing and Drainage, requires that

‘To prevent any unreasonable rise in the temperature of the cold water delivered to fixtures located within a building, pipes and fittings installed above the ground should be protected against the heating effects of solar radiation or other heat sources’ .

There should either be insulation/lagging installed to all cold-water piping in these areas, or alternatively these pipes should be relocated to ensure compliance with the Plumbing Regulations and Australian Standards.
